treatment.file: Mypullorum Mygallinaceum Mygallopavonis Myiowae Mycolumbinsale Mysynoviae Jordan et al 1982
treatment.description: Mycoplasma synoviae ferments glucose aerobically and anaerobically, does not utilize arginine or urea, does not ferment tetrazolium chloride or show phosphatase activity, and produces film and spots. G+C content of DNA: 34 mol%. Serologically distinct. Type strain: WVU 1853 (= ATCC 25204 = NCTC 10124).
